holidays.name: National Cousins Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to celebrating the bonds between cousins, those uniquely close relatives who often feel like siblings or best friends.
holidays.origin: Origin unknown, but embraced widely on social media as a way to appreciate family ties beyond immediate siblings and parents.
holidays.funFact: Cousins once held special importance in royal successions and historical alliances, making this day a nod to those powerful family connections!

holidays.name: Simputeon Day
holidays.description: A quirky, unofficial holiday celebrated by fans of simulations and emulators, often marked by enjoying video game emulators or simulated environments.
holidays.origin: Named in geek circles, 'Simputeon' is a playful mashup of 'simulation' and 'emulation' highlighting digital nostalgia.
holidays.funFact: On Simputeon Day, some fans host marathons of classic games running on emulators, reliving pixelated memories from decades ago.

holidays.name: National Tequila Day
holidays.description: A spirited celebration honoring tequila, the iconic Mexican distilled beverage made from the blue agave plant.
holidays.origin: Became popularized in the U.S. during the 2000s as tequila gained popularity far beyond Mexico.
holidays.funFact: Tequila must be made from at least 51% blue agave, but the best ones are 100% blue agave and have distinct regional flavors.

holidays.name: Amelia Earhart Day
holidays.description: A day to commemorate pioneering aviator Amelia Earhart, the first woman to fly solo across the Atlantic Ocean.
holidays.origin: Observed on her birthday, July 24, to honor her adventurous spirit and contributions to aviation.
holidays.funFact: Despite her disappearance in 1937, Amelia Earhart remains a symbol of courage and tenacity, inspiring countless pilots and explorers.
